channel.title: [317] HELP [Delta Source]
channel.description:
I need help on a few things with my Server. :D
1. how to change the directions my NPCs face
[s]2. command to teleport to varrrock square '::varrock'[/s]
3. Change the locations of my shops
4. change where people log in at
5. change what people get when the log in -eg 3M in their inventory when they log on-
6. that well thing where you use money on it and you get a random item
7. a working jail that you cant escape from -read below-
like sorta the delta jails but it has normal, oak, willow, yew, mage trees... and clay, tin, copper, iron, coal, mith, addy, rune rocks so the prisioners mine or WC and sell their rocks/logs to a shop there for 1GP each and they need 250GP to open the door and get out. and theres no bank at the jail they just go to jail and a bronze axe and pickaxe appear in their inventory
8. making custom skillcape emotes with a '::cape' command so when they type ::cape it does the emote of the skillcape they have on and if they dont have a skillcape it says they need to be wearing a skillcape... like if they have attack cape on it does attack emote. Just put one emote code and 3 GFX codes ill change them

item.title: [317] HELP [Delta Source]
item.dc:creator: @reverce reverce
item.description:
@reverce wrote:

Change the locations of my shops --> just move the npc in autospawn file

[quote=“Jc22493, post:9, topic:285436”]3) Autospawn configuration file.
4) The player class.
5) The initialize() method in the client class.
6) The misc.random() method, I believe.
8)

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("cape") && (playerEquipment[playerCape] == capeID)) { // Do stuff. }[/quote]
for jail use a TUT

Read full topic

item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

People post the same topics over and over about little and easy server problems… they didn’t make a search feature for nothing on moparscape…
just be careful not to gravedig.

item.title: [317] HELP [Delta Source]

item.description:
@Duch-PRO wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:4, topic:285436”]that wont work, with delta doesn’t it have to be like

if(cmd.startsWith(“varrock”) && playerRights > 0){
triggerTele(xcord, ycord, 0);[/quote]

No dude, ur wrong, this looks more like a 508 script.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] HELP [Delta Source]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

  1. Autospawn configuration file.
  2. The player class.
  3. The initialize() method in the client class.
  4. The misc.random() method, I believe.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("cape") && (playerEquipment[playerCape] == capeID)) { // Do stuff. }

Read full topic

item.title: [317] HELP [Delta Source]
item.dc:creator: @Umah Umah
item.description:
@Umah wrote:

For 1., you can’t change the way an npc faces. Unless you can make a huge code that will allow it, it wont allow you.

  1. Open up player.java, leave it open, login with a new account, logout without moving, go into character files, and look at the x-coords and y-coords its standing at. then search the x-coords in player.java. say it was edgeville. you would type the x coord until you found the match.

  2. Same thing, leave player.java open, make a new account, look at the starter, mainly the money. now, say it gave you 50m when you first started, so search “995, 50000000”. There should be a list of numbers and commas near it. Maybe like “addItem(995, 50000000” or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] HELP [Delta Source]
item.dc:creator: @bl00d_furyz bl00d furyz
item.description:
@bl00d_furyz wrote:

For the ::varrock command go into your Client.java and look for commands!

look for
if(command.startsWith(“hail”) && playerRights > 2){
hail();
}

put this under the hail command
if(command.startsWith(“varrock”) && playerRights > 0){
triggerTele(xcord, ycord, 0);

Just do ::mypos and find the cords for x,y and put them down and leave the 0.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 25, 2009, 05:59:03 pm[/size][hr]If you need a coder just add my AIM skaterpunk9091

Read full topic
